Key Arguments: The legislation threatens free speech by restricting it to a privileged few.
The government has a history of incorrectly defining misinformation, as demonstrated during the Covid-19 pandemic.
Censorship can lead to more harm than the misinformation it seeks to prevent.
The government should protect individual rights, not suppress them.
Notable Quotes: More harm will be caused by silencing Australians!
The recent history of the government attempting to define what is 'misinformation' causes grave concerns about this bill.
This one example shows why allowing the government the power to legislate against free speech is a recipe for disaster.
